definition: to accept the new/to take fresh (air)/fig. to accept new members (to reinvigorate the party)/new blood
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
lit. to breathe out stale air and breathe in fresh (idiom, from Zhuangzi 庄子); fig. to get rid of the old and bring in the new

sentences.english: New life keeps the energy flowing, like the breath of the world.
sentences.chinese: 新的生命將持續着能量的流動，世界正在吐故納新。

sentences.english: Breathing got self-renewing, but produced foam accumulation.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸作用得到了吐故納新，但產生了泡沫的堆積。

sentences.english: Until Parliament resumes in five weeks, nothing substantial happens.
sentences.chinese: 除非在議會納新的五週裏，其餘時間工作沒什麼變化。

sentences.english: Party workers sallied forth in a drive to find new members.
sentences.chinese: 黨的工作人員發起了納新運動。

sentences.english: That's because they were able to connect experiences they've had and synthesize new things.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲他們能把種種體驗關聯起來，並吐故納新。
